column19: Basilica of Santa Maria, Porto
column20: EDH and Trismegistos record that it is now held in this Basilica (in its art museum?), but was inscribed in Dalmatia (CIL). For the former reason, the EDCS seems to record (incorrectly) that it was found in Ravenna (where the Basilica is). Unsure of why or how it arrived in Ravenna after it was recorded in the CIL. Perhaps moved across for the re-opening of the Church in 1900, as part of its restoration in 1944, or its promotion to 'Basilica' in 1960. It has also has had an art Gallery since 1972. Wikipedia, 2019: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Santa_Maria_in_Porto_Basilica. Accessed: 26/06/2020

column9: Ex [dec(reto) P(ubli) Corn(eli)] / Dol(abellae) leg(ati) pr(o) [pr(aetore)] / det(erminavit) C(aius) Titius / Geminus >(centurio) / leg(ionis) VII inte[r] / Asser(iates) et C[or(nienses)]
column17: It refers to the renewal of a demarcation made by Legio VII member between 14-20 CE however
column19: lost
column21: the individual refered to in this stelae could be the same as the one referenced in CIL 3, 9973. Čače believed this arguing that the name sextus in CIL 3, 9973 was incorrect, and should be Gaius ('G' not 'S'). However, it could also be a brother, hence the hesitation to confirm Gaius' position as a centurio.

column9: Severus Triocha/ri f(ilius) Ubius / eq(ues) ala(e) Tu/ngr(orum) ann(orum) / XXVI sti(pendiorum) V / h(ic) s(itus) e(st) Urban/us fratri pos(u)it
column17: date provided by Cambi 1994
column19: Arheološki muzej u Splitu/Archaeological Museum in Split
column22: while this stela does not belong to a Legio VII legionary, it is included in this DB as an exemplum of other military funerary stelae which would have been situated near or beside those of Legio VII members. It is also an example of a stela produced at the Tilurium workshop in a different style to that typical of monuments belonging to Legio VII legionaries

column9: C(aius) Iulius Bar/cenei f(ilius) The/odorus m/iles coh(ortis) II / Cyrrhesta/rum annor(um) / LXV stipen(diorum) XLII / h(ic) s(itus) e(st) posuit / C(aius) Iulius Scapula / frat(er)
column17: date provided by Cambi 1994
column19: Arheološki muzej u Splitu/Archaeological Museum in Split
column22: while this stela does not belong to a Legio VII legionary, it is included in this DB as an exemplum of how the stelae produced at Tilurium changed in style over time. Cambi 1994: e.g. One can see a reduction in the four pannels motif, with this stelae depicting two pannels
